com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.client

Class EncodeDecodeValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.client.EncodeDecodeValue

  • public class EncodeDecodeValue
extends Object
    Utility class to encode/decode RDF Values for interchange with the REST API.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

      • decodeValue

        public static org.openrdf.model.Value decodeValue(String s)
        Decode a URI or Literal.
        Parameters:
        s - The value to be decoded.
        Returns:
        The URI or literal -or- null if the argument was null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the request parameter could not be decoded as an RDF Value.

        Returns:

      • decodeURI

        public static org.openrdf.model.URI decodeURI(String param)

        Parameters:
        param - The encoded value.
        Returns:
        The URI -or- null if the argument was null.

      • encodeValue

        public static String encodeValue(org.openrdf.model.Value v)
        Encode an RDF Value as it should appear if used in a SPARQL query. E.g., a literal will look like "abc", "abc"@en or "3"^^xsd:int. A URI will look like <http://www.bigdata.com/> .
        Parameters:
        v - The value (optional).
        Returns:
        The encoded value -or- null if the argument is null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is a BNode.

      • decodeContexts

        public static org.openrdf.model.Resource[] decodeContexts(String[] strings)
        Decode an array of named graph contexts.
        Parameters:
        strings - An array of encoded named graph contexts (required).
        Returns:
        An array of decoded resources that is 1:1 with the original array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null.
        See Also:
        com.bigdata.rdf.store.BD;#NULL_GRAPH, Resource... contexts not encoded/decoded according to openrdf semantics (REST API)

      • encodeContexts

        public static String[] encodeContexts(org.openrdf.model.Resource[] values)
        Encode each Resource.

        Note: When generating URL parameters, we will have zero or more &c=... instances. These are turned into a Resource[]. If there are no such arguments, then the array needs to be turned into Resource[0] on receipt by the webapp in order to be correctly decoded by decodeContexts(String[]).

        Parameters:
        values - An array of RDF Values.
        Returns:
        An array of encoded RDF values that is 1:1 with the original array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null.
        See Also:
        com.bigdata.rdf.store.BD;#NULL_GRAPH, Resource... contexts not encoded/decoded according to openrdf semantics (REST API)
